main event: A civilian witness observed a fast-moving bright light in the sky for about 10 seconds in Pierz, Minnesota on August 6, 1965.
interesting points: The light appeared near the constellation Draco and seemed to brighten and dim steadily several times per second.
The witness stated the object was moving faster than any satellite they had seen before.
The witness did not hear any sound from the object.
The witness wrote to the Project Blue Book Information Office seeking an explanation for the sighting.
The report was classified as an 'astro (Meteor)' by Project Blue Book.
sighted object: a fast-moving bright light in the sky
